text: I've protested in the strongest possible

believe all the other opposition parties

acceptable it's not on what the Prime
Minister is doing is a sort of smash and
grab on our democracy in order to force
through a No Deal exit from the European
Union what's he so afraid of that he
needs to suspend Parliament to prevent
Parliament discussing these matters
so when Parliament does meet on his
timetable very briefly next week the
first thing we'll do is attempt
legislation to prevent what he's doing
and secondly we'll challenge him on a
motion of confidence at some point it is
a constitutional outrage this is an
attempt by the Prime Minister who was
elected by a very small number of people
in the country as serve tea party
membership to ride roughshod over
Parliament and prevent any legislation

leaving the EU without a deal and all
the problems that it will cause he seems
to want to run headlong into the arms of
Donald Trump with more determination
than I've ever seen anyone else before
this is extraordinary he needs to be
held to account by Parliament not by
shutting down Parliament but by
attending Parliament and answering the
questions but they can of course bring
forward a new listed program that's the
proper time the proper time isn't as a
way of avoiding what he knows will be a
big parliamentary job majority against
